title: Rotating Game Mode brain dump: Round 2
body:
http://na.leagueoflegends.com/sites/default/files/styles/scale_xlarge/public/upload/rgm-banner_1920x1080.jpg

Heya guys, it's been about a month since the last one of these I did. Got a good response last time to sharing so, in the spirit of transparency, thought I'd do another brain dump RE the RGM queue and alternate game modes. ^_^o

**"My favourite mode is _[insert mode here]_. When is it getting added to the queue!?"**
I spoke to this briefly last time, so will recap again here. We're still forging the path atm with our current stable of modes, and are carefully looking at how each one is received and engaged with. The modes you've seen so far represent the widest spread of gameplay with strong engagement, which is why we chose them first. With that said, any game mode that we've previously done is a potential candidate for the RGM queue, so if your favourite mode isn't in there yet, there's a chance we could get to it sometime in the future.

**"The time between reappearances of modes is too long/short. It should be shorter/longer."**
As you might suspect, this changes mode to mode and player to player, depending on what they like. We are interested though in seeing differing cadences could look like. For example, we currently have about 6 weeks between modes reappearing, but maybe we could shorten that to 4 weeks letting us focus on bigger updates to particular  modes on a slightly longer cadence. Still iterating on this process to figure out what delivers the best updates to each mode when they come back.

**"I work weekends and can't play the modes. When will you extend the queue up-time?"**
We currently have the queue up for 3 days at a time, kicking off with Friday. The RGM queue has been quite healthy, so we're investigating extending it to Monday going forward, making for a total of 4 days each weekend. As with all things, this is subject to change (you never know sometimes with gamedev) but we're looking into it right now. Soon(tm).

**"When will Champion Mastery be added to ARAM/TT?"**
Got you covered fam. <3
http://boards.pbe.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/champions-gameplay-feedback/TwJZ1Upd-champion-mastery-in-aramtt-live-for-testing-on-pbe

I'll chill in this thread to catch any other questions. ^.^

So I have been liking the RGM in general with the only exception being in certain modes things become so meta that you either have to ban them or get called...potentially rude things, for not. But even if you ban them, something else super powerful gets through so my question is, what is your opinion on ways to break these metas so the modes don't get stale because of them? 

Otherwise I've enjoyed the game modes. Even the ones I was meh about before feel nice with the addition of Champion Mastery too since even if I lose I still feel like I am getting something out of it.

We have some of our own ideas on how to "break the meta" that coalesces around each mode, but are interested in hearing from you guys too. The most frequent suggestions I see include:
-- More bans
-- Perma-ban X champs
-- Make random champ select

Any others?

Nemesis URF? :P

Edit:  By which I mean you could always do a Nemesis version of a game mode every now and then.

Nemesis URF is actually Genius. 

Might not do much to increase the range of banned Champions, but the mode will take on a completely different light.

Top 10 ~ish champs in winrate at the end of first 24 hours are perma banned for the remainder of the weekend. After another 24 hours perma ban the new top 10 ~ish champs in winrate (20 ~ish total removed)

Each game you are given **10 random champions and you choose 1** of them to play.
At least 1 of those champions is from the free rotation, so you always have at least 1 option, even if you dont own the other 9. (Its better to force a free rotation champion rather than an owned one, to avoid the ARAM-account syndrome)

This champion select would provably work with all non-serious gamemodes

> More bans

http://i.imgur.com/Ufbr5ej.gif
This is a list of suggestions, not a "to-do list". ^_- Doesn't hurt to discuss all possible options.

Just my 2 cents; I think it would help reduce stagnation to do the following:

1) let each player ban 1 champion.
2) draft pick

Doing both would still leave a roster of OVER 100 champions! And it would keep a "leader" from ignoring his team and either troll banning, or just banning champions that he doesn't like.

Draft pick!!  I'm dying for draft pick URF especially, but I think it should be considered for any mode you pick your champs.  A chance to mitigate what you're up against instead of rolling a die to see whose OP counters whose is so helpful.  The side effect of mirror matches being disallowed enforces a higher minimum variety each game, and mirror matches are largely unpleasant for the game in general anyway.  It's very hard to deal with a snowballed mirror champ, and the "why aren't you as good as their team's X" business is never pleasant.

Draft pick feels like it would solve a lot of the issues with URF. Everyone has had those horrible URF games where one team picks fun/non-meta URF champions and the other picks 5 of the broken champions and the game is obviously over by 5 minutes because one team is completely unable to deal with the other. A lot of that happens because the team picking the strong champions just assumes that they have to (people don't want to risk picking weaker champions if they suspect they'll be facing the meta picks) and as someone who's been on both sides of that, I usually feel really rubbish if I'm the one with pretty good champions destroying the enemy team's fun. What can I do about it though? If I hadn't picked those champions I would have had zero chance of dealing with someone like Hecarim or Zed on the enemy team.

If you make it draft you remove the "I need to be able to deal with anything" fear of URF. If you see the enemy picks people who are poor/average in URF then you can choose fun picks too, and if you see them picking strong champions then you can pick them too. You'd have more variety in picks because one of the primary drives for picking broken champions ("The enemy might have them too") is gone and you remove the "I got stomped through no fault of my own" problem too - if you lose in champ select it'll be because you didn't make good use of/ignored the information available to you, not because you got unlucky.

Of course, draft could introduce other problems and maybe it being draft would make people take the game more seriously overall, but I still believe that people taking URF a bit more seriously than normal would cause a lot less anti-fun in champ select than the current blind factor does.

I'd just like to add a vote for adding Nemesis Draft to RGM.  It really opened my eyes to a lot of champions that I otherwise rarely/never see in games.
So what you're saying is you're now a Taric main after last Nemesis Draft and can't wait to wreck people who mistakenly hand him out again post-rework? :3

I'm also a nemesis draft fan.

A world where building champions the 'wrong' way (damage on supports, AP variants of typical AD champs, AD variants of AP champs...) is sometimes actually optimal, and a lot of fun.

Plus people aren't necessarily expected to know their champs, so there's less anxiety surrounding being a let down. Not to mention since it's still SR which is balanced around, there's no totally nonviable champs (in contrast with ARAM, where champs poor at teamfighting are kinda lackluster).
I'm sure it's been asked a thousand times already, but what's your opinion (official or your personal one) on allowing these game modes in custom games outside of their chosen weekend?

Maybe not "a thousand". :P

Having alternate modes be permanently available in customs is the same as having them in a permanent queue. While the way you get into the game might look different, the backend Design and Tech constraints are exactly the same, so when we talk about one, we're also talking about the other. As we've mentioned before, making these modes permanent feels like a short route to them becoming the next Dominion (and we don't want to repeat that mistake). These modes are designed as short-term engagement experiences; they burn twice as bright for half as long. Rotating them each weekend avoids burning them out, is more manageable on mode maintenance, and let's us keep giving you guys a variety of modes to play for the future.

Sorry, couldn't resist.

So, this is probably an unfortunate thing to ask but I'm curious: Do you find any "meh" in the game mode currently? Anything that lacks a large player base? From what I can gather, people aren't thrilled about poro king. Everything else seems fairly liked.
Poro King is one of the strongest modes currently in the rotation, despite it also being the one of the most reoccuring modes over the past 3 years. It doesn't seem to matter, all hail the King. :D
Damn, really? Well that surprises me.
Provably 80 to 90% of the poro king population is just people playing "ARAM with mastery"

I'd be curious if there's a corresponding drop in ARAM activity when PK is active (specifically moreso than any drop in ARAM that might occur when other FGMs are running). I know I was switching to PK while it was active since it was a way to play on HA and actually earn mastery points, even though I mostly play ARAM otherwise. 

Side note: I'm stoked for mastery on ARAM finally, though it'll likely lower my time spent on PK once it's out.

So how did Defiantly Not Dominion turn out?  Judging from the queues, it bombed pretty hard.

Speaking as a long time Dominion player on the higher end of the MMR scale, the map had quite a few systemic issues.  Mostly problems with it being super one-sided since the team that lacks Windmill doesn't have a disruptive option to attack (bottom lane) to work toward dislodging the enemy team.  Might I suggest opening up bottom lane and sticking another objective in the middle of it?  The bottom lane should probably be focused on helping whoever is behind at the moment.  I would go so far as to suggest not having the Minion Relic spawn for your team if you control Windmill.

Barring more Dominion fiddling, League *desperately* needs a fast, 'fun' mode that lets you pick your champion.  Because right now we've only got one 'fun' map, and you can't pick anything there.
